conclusion: Analyzing ideal gas properties and geometric relationships
Identify known values for ideal gas in states A and B
State A: Pressure pA = p0, Temperature TA = T0, Volume VA = V0
State B: Volume VB = 2V0, Temperature TB = T0
Line segment OC extends to B, need to find temperature at state C
Recall ideal gas law: PV = nRT
Define terms in ideal gas law: P = pressure, V = volume, n = moles, R = gas constant, T = temperature
Point C is on the line from O to B, O is at (0, 0), B is at (T0, 2V0)
Slope of line OB is m = 2V0/T0
Equation of line OB is V = (2V0/T0)·T
Point C appears at (TC, VC) where VC = V0/2
Verify consistency with ideal gas law for states A and C
Calculate pC = p0/2 using ideal gas law equations
Pressure reduces proportionally along OB line
Final answer: Temperature at state C is TC = T0/4
